chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
z: pos n
y: pos n
x: pos n
Hxy: x <> y
Hxz: x <> z
Hyz: y <> z
i: nat
y': pos n
l: list bool
w: Vector.t (list bool) n
v: Vector.t (list bool) n

Goal:
v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y][(rev l ++ v#>z)/z] -> (i, copy_rev_stack) // (i, v) ->> (9 + i, w)

in_bsm_sss_pop_1 : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n0 : nat, vec ?A (S n0) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (a ## vec_nil)) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n0 : nat) (v0 : vec ?A (S n0)), P n0 v0 -> P (S n0) (a ## v0)) -> forall (n0 : nat) (v : vec ?A (S n0)), P n0 v where ?A : [n : nat x : pos n y : pos n z : pos n Hxy : x <> y Hxz : x <> z Hyz : y <> z i : nat y' := y : pos n l : list bool v : vec (list bool) n w : vec (list bool) n |- Type]
subcode_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l r : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a ++ r) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
subcode_snoc_inv : forall (X : Type) (Q : code X) (i j : nat) (a l : list X), j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q
in_bsm_sss_pop_E : forall (n i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)

```coq
intros H1 H2 H3.
assert (A1: (i, move_rev_stack x y (5 + i)) // (i, v) ->> (7 + i, v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y])).
- eapply bsm_sss_sind.
  + intros. apply in_bsm_sss_pop_E. reflexivity.
  + intros. apply in_bsm_sss_pop_0. assumption.
  + intros. apply in_bsm_sss_pop_1. assumption.
  + intros. apply bsm_sss.
  + intros. apply bsm_sss.
  + intros. apply bsm_sss.
  + eapply move_rev_stack_spec; eassumption.
destruct A1 as [a1 [HC1 HT1]].
eapply subcode_app_inv with (l := POP x (5 + i) (9 + i) :: nil).
unfold copy_rev_stack.
simpl.
rewrite <- plus_assoc.
rewrite plus_comm.
simpl.
apply subcode_snoc_inv with (l := move_rev_stack x y (5 + i)) (a := [PUSH y One; PUSH z One; PUSH y' Zero; POP y' i i; PUSH y Zero; PUSH z Zero; PUSH x Zero; POP x i i] ++ nil).
unfold copy_rev_stack; simpl; reflexivity.
exists a1.
split.
- assumption.
- apply HT1.
Qed.
```
